comment.author: 39967544@N00
comment._content:
A lovely atmospheric photo of (I think) one of the many Norddeutscher Lloyd (North German Lloyd) pre-World War 1 passenger and cargo liners this Company used seasonally on both its Australian and North American services. Several of these ships had two funnels and had long names; the single funnel ships were named after generals and rivers and had short names. This vessel has a single funnel and a long name - I'm still working on its identity.
I wonder if the tug in this Sydney photo is the Waratah of 1902, now a museum ship? 
Some guesswork here.
